hub.subtitle: Global Standard of Excellence Enforcement Platform.

manifesto.title: THE FRANCIS INTELLIGENCE MANIFESTO
manifesto.subtitle: Autonomous Predictive Maintenance & Forensic Diagnostics
manifesto.quote: "Between failure and stability stands only the precision of our data."

section1.title: ARCHIVE INTEGRITY (NC-7.0)
section1.content: Based on the absolute integrity of 854 physical engineering sources. Every data point is verified via SHA-256 hash algorithm, ensuring diagnoses are immutable and grounded in verified machine history.
section1.quote: "Verified against 854+ sources — knowledge is our first line of defense."

section2.title: PREDICTIVE LOGIC (NC-8.0)
section2.content: We do not wait for thresholds; we predict them. Using linear regression of vibration trends ($VIB\_X\_PEAK$), AnoHUB identifies deviations 72 hours before critical failure, pushing the boundaries of PdM.

section3.title: ISO STANDARDIZATION
section3.content: Every 'Physics Breach' and neural impulse is interpreted strictly according to ISO 10816-5 protocols. Our telemetry is digital evidence aligned with global engineering norms.

footer.signed: Digitally Signed // Shaft Stability Matrix Confirmed

insights.title: Engineering Insight
insights.waterHammerCritical: CRITICAL: Water hammer risk detected. Adjust guide vane closure rate.

q1.text: Do you verify intake velocity profiles using CFD or physical scale models?

q2.text: Is the "0.05 mm/m" alignment tolerance strictly enforced in contracts?

q3.text: Are vibration spectra (FFT) integrated into the SCADA logic?

q4.text: Do you have EN 10204 3.1 certificates for all runner bolts?

q6.text: Is the runner clearance (gap) monitored and logged annually?

q7.text: When failures occur, is a Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA) performed?
options: Often we only fix the symptom
Sometimes we only fix the symptom

q8.text: Is there an automated lubrication system for the wicket gate bearings?

q9.text: Are spare parts (seals, bearings) strictly OEM certified?

q10.text: Is the oil quality (water content/particles) monitored in real-time?

q11.text: Do you measure the "Execution Gap" (Planned vs. Actual maintenance time)?

q12.text: Does the contract enforce specific penalties for alignment deviations?

q13.text: Is the cavitation pitting depth measured during every major overhaul?

q14.text: Are vibration sensors installed on all main bearings?

q15.text: Is the SCADA system updated with the latest security patches?

q16.text: Is the emergency shutdown sequence tested annually?

q17.text: What is the current condition of the draft tube concrete surface?

contractManagement.title: Smart Contract
contractManagement.subtitle: Automated warranty validation & dynamic penalty calculation based on live risk data.
contractManagement.noAssetDesc: Select a project above to execute legal analysis.
contractManagement.legalEnforcementDesc: Generate legally binding notices based on real-time data.

pdf.intro1: Pursuant to the Master Service Agreement, AnoHUB system has detected
pdf.intro2: deviations from the mandatory Standard of Excellence.

logic.breachReasonCritical: CRITICAL OPERATIONAL RISK DETECTED ({{flags}} flags via Neural Link)
logic.breachReasonScore: Operational Risk Score exceeds safety threshold.

componentLibrary.noComponents: No components available in the library.
componentLibrary.title: Technical

design.title: Overall Plant Design & Engineering
design.description: A holistic engineering approach covering civil structures, equipment selection, layout, and system integration. This phase dictates the long-term performance and represents the first opportunity to close the Execution Gap.
kpis: Adherence to safety and environmental mandates

miv.title: Main Inlet Valve (MIV)
miv.description: The primary safety shut-off valve. Its reliability is non-negotiable for plant safety and maintenance isolation. Failure here represents a catastrophic risk.

risks.text: Seal leakage causing water loss and erosion

rotor.title: Turbine Runner and Blades
rotor.description: The heart of energy conversion. Blades must be designed for maximum efficiency and treated with 13Cr4Ni to ensure immunity against cavitation and erosion.

guide_vanes.title: Guide Vane Apparatus (Wicket Gate)
guide_vanes.description: The regulation mechanism controlling flow and power. Precision in linkage and clearances is vital to prevent leakage and ensure responsive grid regulation.
kpis: Wear rate on facing plates and pivots

risks.text: Jamming due to debris or sediment wedge

shaft_sealing.title: Shaft Sealing System
shaft_sealing.description: The barrier between the river and the powerhouse. Modern mechanical or carbon seals must be monitored to prevent flooding and ensure environmental compliance.

risks.text: Loss of vacuum in draft tube (Reaction turbines)
Shaft sleeve wear at sealing location

bearings.title: Bearings (Guide and Thrust)
bearings.description: These support the rotating mass and hydraulic thrust. Their health is directly linked to the "0.05 mm/m" alignment mandate. Failure here is often a symptom of poor alignment.

risks.text: Wiping of white metal (Babbitt) due to overheating

generator.title: Generator
generator.description: Converts mechanical torque into electrical power. Its insulation and cooling systems are critical for longevity and efficiency.

control_system.title: Control System (SCADA & PLC)
control_system.description: The brain of the plant. It enables the "Digital Twin", predictive maintenance (AI), and remote operation. Obsolescence here is a major strategic risk.

risks.text: Sensor drift leading to false operations

hydraulic_system.title: Hydraulic Power Unit (HPU) & Governor
hydraulic_system.description: The muscle of the regulation system. It actuates the MIV, Guide Vanes, and Blades. Oil cleanliness is the single most critical factor for reliability.

lubrication_system.title: Centralized Lubrication System
lubrication_system.description: The lifeblood of mechanical components. Automated delivery of oil/grease to bearings and bushings ensures the friction-free operation required for LCC optimization.

cooling_system.title: Cooling System
cooling_system.description: Manages thermal loads from the generator and bearings. Typically raw water or closed-loop. Efficiency here directly impacts the lifespan of insulation and oil.

risks.text: Insufficient capacity at peak summer temps

digitalIntegrity.title: Immutable Trust Ledger
digitalIntegrity.noAssetDesc: Select a project above to enable mining operations.

toast.selectAsset: Please select a Target Asset first.
toast.verified: Cryptographic integrity confirmed. Ledger is immutable.

digitalIntro.heroText: We don't just inspect power plants. We solve the fundamental equation of Dynamic Risk versus Operational Certainty.
digitalIntro.quote: For years, I watched the industry accept a 48% failure rate as 'unavoidable wear and tear'. I realized standard maintenance wasn't enough. We needed a forensic approach. We needed to treat a hydropower plant not like a static building, but like a living organism with an immune system.

card1.title: Forensic Truth
card1.desc: We don't guess. We measure. Using sub-surface NDT and 3D metrology, we provide data that holds up in a court of law.

card2.title: Dirty Hands. Clean Data.
card2.desc: We don't just generate reports. We turn wrenches, machine steel, and weld cavitation. From the banal basics to advanced forensics.

card3.title: The Cultural Betrayal
card3.desc: Why the Low-Bid Policy is an act of corporate violence against assets. We stand for the Zero-Tolerance Protocol.

activation.lockedText1: You've Seen The Vision. Now See The Logic.
activation.toastParams: Immunity Protocol Activated. Welcome to the Command Center.

genderEquity.title: Inclusivity Analytics
genderEquity.desc: Tracking real-time metrics on workforce diversity and ESG compliance.

strategy.impContent: True engineering precision extends beyond mechanical tolerances to the precision of human capital management. An organization that fails to attract, retain, and promote diverse talent suffers from a deep, systemic failure.
strategy.impQuote: This is not just an HR initiative; it is a strategic imperative for eliminating a critical source of systemic risk and closing the Execution Gap.
strategy.redefSub: Inclusive Growth as a Technical Standard
strategy.card1Content: If we tolerate 10% bias in our hiring, that is equivalent to building a turbine with a 10% tolerance gap. Both are conscious decisions that knowingly guarantee future system failure.
strategy.card2Content: Just as technical precision is required to 0.05 mm/m, organizational precision requires a zero-tolerance policy for bias.

hppImprovements.title: HPP Ino-Hub
hppImprovements.subtitle: Collaborative Engineering Intelligence. Capture breakthrough ideas.
hppImprovements.emptyTitle: No ideas found in this category.

installationGuarantee.title: Installation Guarantee
installationGuarantee.subtitle: The 0.05 mm/m Protocol. Non-negotiable precision mandate during assembly.
installationGuarantee.remarksPlaceholder: Document any deviations, risks, or corrective actions taken...
installationGuarantee.toastSelect: Please select a Target Asset before saving the audit.

feedback.thankYouDesc: Your feedback is invaluable for refining the Standard of Excellence.
feedback.rateDesc: Help us engineer a better platform.
feedback.placeholder: Optional: What can we improve to close the Execution Gap?

0.title: Welcome to AnoHUB
0.subtitle: Systemic Risk & Excellence Platform
0.content: Your central command for strategic hydropower management. We bridge the gap between engineering precision and operational reality.

1.title: Strategic Arsenal
1.subtitle: Tools for Zero-Tolerance
1.content: Access the 'Risk Assessment Tool' to quantify the Execution Gap and the 'Installation Standard' to enforce the 0.05 mm/m mandate.

2.title: Innovation Engine
2.subtitle: Configure & Optimize
2.content: Model power output with the 'HPP Calculator' and capture breakthrough ideas in the 'Ino-Hub'. Innovation meets discipline.

3.title: Systems Online
3.subtitle: Ready for Deployment
3.content: The platform is calibrated and ready. Engage with the tools to secure your warranty and optimize Life Cycle Costs.

projectPhase.title: Project Phase Execution
projectPhase.subtitle: Step-by-step enforcement of the Three Postulates across the asset lifecycle. Eliminating the Execution Gap at every milestone.

phase1.title: Defining the Non-Negotiables
phase1.desc: The Execution Gap begins here. Vague contracts lead to vague results. We mandate specific ISO tolerances and material certificates directly in the tender documents.
phase1.m2: Require EN 10204 3.1 certificates for all critical steel.

phase2.title: Zero Tolerance Assembly
phase2.desc: The point of no return. Once concrete is poured and shafts are coupled, errors become permanent liabilities. Digital verification is mandatory.
phase2.m3: Cold vs. Hot alignment compensation checks.

phase3.title: Predictive Discipline
phase3.desc: Moving from 'Fix it when it breaks' to 'Fix it before it deviates'. The M-E Synergy Gap is closed by integrating SCADA data with mechanical reality.

revitalization.title: Asset Revitalization & Obsolescence
revitalization.desc: Data-driven decision making: Life extension vs. Replacement. Ensuring LCC Optimization by closing the M-E Synergy Gap.

lea.title: Life Extension Analysis (LEA)
lea.subtitle: Strategic Decision Framework
lea.content: We introduce the Systemic Degradation Score. This integrates RCFA data, vibration deviations, and outage costs to determine if a component is truly at End-of-Life (EOL).
lea.quote: A full replacement is only acceptable when systemic risk dictates it, not when the market demands it. Ethics first.

twin.title: The Retrospective Digital Twin
twin.desc: Mapping a Legacy Asset using 3D scanning & thermal imaging.

risk.title: Obsolescence Risk Matrix
risk.subtitle: Audit Targets: SCADA, Governors, Relays
risk.content: Technology moves faster than hydro assets. We track the gap between your installed base and vendor support lifecycles.
risk.alertContent: The biggest risk is not hardware failure, but Information Loss. When vendor support ends and knowledge hasn't been transferred to a Digital Twin, you face a massive Execution Gap.
risk.gap: The M-E Synergy Gap occurs here.

cta.title: Retirement or Reinvention?
cta.desc: Schedule an expert audit to scientifically determine the future of your asset.

riskAssessment.standbyDesc: [EN] Sistem je u stanju pripravnosti. Molimo odaberite Ciljnu Imovinu iznad za početak analize Jaza u Izvršenju.

riverWildlife.title: [EN] Ekološki Inženjering
riverWildlife.subtitle: [EN] Tehnologije o kojima se ne pregovara ispunjavaju etički mandat za Zaštitu Ekosistema.
riverWildlife.mandateDesc: [EN] Mi ne ublažavamo samo uticaj; mi aktivno štitimo ekosistem. Automatsko mjerenje E-Protoka je osnovni zahtjev Standarda Izvrsnosti.

fish_passage.title: [EN] Tehnologije Ribljih Staza
fish_passage.subtitle: [EN] Bio-Inženjering za Migraciju
fish_passage.intro: [EN] Moderne tehnologije fokusiraju se na siguran, efikasan i minimalno stresan prolaz oko brana radi očuvanja biodiverziteta.

ladders.title: [EN] Riblje Ljestve i Stepeništa
ladders.desc: [EN] Kanali tipa Pool-and-Weir ili Denil sa nagibima (1:8 do 1:12) dizajnirani da vode ribe bez iscrpljivanja.

lifts.title: [EN] Riblji Liftovi i Elevatori
lifts.desc: [EN] Mehanički spremnici za visoke brane gdje su ljestve nepraktične. Automatizovano prikupljanje i puštanje.

bypass.title: [EN] Prirolika Obilaznica
bypass.desc: [EN] Vještački kanali koji oponašaju prirodne potoke. Ekološki najefikasnije rješenje sa malim nagibom.

turbines.title: [EN] Riblje-Prijateljske Turbine
turbines.desc: [EN] Napredni dizajni (npr. Alden) sa manje lopatica i širim razmacima za smanjenje smrtnosti od udara lopatica.

sediment_management.title: [EN] Upravljanje Sedimentom i Erozijom
sediment_management.subtitle: [EN] Zaštita Kapaciteta Rezervoara i Opreme
sediment_management.intro: [EN] Brane zarobljavaju sediment, smanjujući kapacitet i uzrokujući abraziju turbina. Proaktivno upravljanje je ključno.

bypass.title: [EN] Obilazni Tuneli
bypass.desc: [EN] Preusmjeravanje vode pune sedimenta tokom poplava.

flushing.title: [EN] Ispiranje
flushing.desc: [EN] Otvaranje niskih ispusta za čišćenje nakupljanja.

watershed.title: [EN] Upravljanje Slivom
watershed.desc: [EN] Pošumljavanje radi smanjenja dotoka na izvoru.

vis.title: [EN] Vizualizacija
vis.l2: [EN] 3D Skeniranje Habanja: Kvantificiranje gubitka materijala radnog kola.

rcfa.title: [EN] RCFA Kritično: Dijagnoza
rcfa.quote: [EN] Tretiranje abrazije bez rješavanja kavitacije vodi do ponovnog kvara.

water_quality.title: [EN] Kvalitet Vode i E-Protok
water_quality.subtitle: [EN] Etički Mandat
water_quality.intro: [EN] Održavanje prirodnih režima toka, temperature i nivoa kiseonika za staništa nizvodno.

eflow.title: [EN] Ekološki Protok (E-tok)
eflow.desc: [EN] Upravljano ispuštanje vode radi oponašanja prirodne varijabilnosti.
eflow.mandate: [EN] Mandat: Automatsko, kontinuirano mjerenje i digitalna dokumentacija se ne pregovaraju.

aerating.title: [EN] Aerirajuće Turbine
aerating.desc: [EN] Prozračivanje turbina radi povećanja nivoa rastvorenog kiseonika.

withdrawal.title: [EN] Selektivno Zahvatanje
withdrawal.desc: [EN] Ulazi na više nivoa za upravljanje temperaturom vode.

habitat_restoration.title: [EN] Restauracija Staništa
habitat_restoration.subtitle: [EN] Više od Ublažavanja
habitat_restoration.intro: [EN] Proaktivne mjere za stvaranje neto pozitivnog ekološkog ishoda.

gravel.title: [EN] Dodavanje Šljunka
gravel.desc: [EN] Postavljanje čistog šljunka za mrijestilišta riba.

riparian.title: [EN] Obalna Zona
riparian.desc: [EN] Ponovna sadnja autohtone vegetacije za stabilizaciju obala i zasjenjivanje vode.

structures.title: [EN] Strukture u Toku
structures.desc: [EN] Stijene i debla koja stvaraju složena staništa toka.

p1.title: [EN] Imperativ 0.05 mm/m
p1.desc: [EN] Apsolutna preciznost poravnanja. Odstupanja vertikalnosti i horizontalnosti veća od 0.05 mm po metru predstavljaju kritičnu neusaglašenost. Odstupanja se ne prihvataju bez obzira na dozvole OEM-a.

p2.title: [EN] Nula "Vozi-do-Kvara"
p2.desc: [EN] Prediktivno održavanje je obavezno. Rad imovine do kvara komponente je kršenje Protokola o Upravljanju Imovinom. Senzori moraju biti aktivni i praćeni.

p3.title: [EN] Integritet Podataka
p3.desc: [EN] Svi operativni podaci, zapisi i procjene rizika moraju biti nepromjenjivi i arhivirani. Prikrivanje operativnih rizika ili "friziranje" brojeva je osnova za trenutni raskid ugovora.

p4.title: [EN] Vlasničko Održavanje
p4.desc: [EN] Operateri djeluju kao vlasnici. Čišćenje, pritezanje i osnovne inspekcije su dnevni rituali, ne zakazani poslovi. Vizuelne inspekcije moraju biti digitalno evidentirane.

oath.title: [EN] Zakletva Inženjera
oath.desc: [EN] Aktivacijom ovog protokola, vežete svoj digitalni identitet za ove standarde.

turbineDetail.notFoundDesc: [EN] Nema tehničkih podataka za ID sredstva:
turbineDetail.subtitle: [EN] Tehnička analiza kritičnih podsistema i načina kvara.
turbineDetail.criticalityNote: [EN] PROCJENA KRITIČNOSTI NA OSNOVU RCFA HISTORIJSKIH PODATAKA

riskAssessment.standbyDesc: System is in standby. Please select a Target Asset above to begin the Execution Gap analysis.

riverWildlife.title: Ecological Engineering
riverWildlife.subtitle: Non-negotiable technologies fulfilling the ethical mandate for Ecosystem Protection.
riverWildlife.mandateDesc: We do not just mitigate impact; we actively protect the ecosystem. Automatic E-Flow measurement is a core requirement of the Standard of Excellence.

fish_passage.title: Fish Passage Technologies
fish_passage.subtitle: Bio-Engineering for Migration
fish_passage.intro: Modern technologies focus on safe, effective, and minimally stressful passage around dams to maintain biodiversity.

ladders.title: Fish Ladders & Stairways
ladders.desc: Pool-and-Weir or Denil channels with gradients (1:8 to 1:12) designed to guide fish without exhaustion.

lifts.title: Fish Lifts & Elevators
lifts.desc: Mechanical hoppers for high dams where ladders are impractical. Automated collection and release.

bypass.title: Nature-Like Bypass
bypass.desc: Man-made channels mimicking natural streams. The most ecologically effective, low-gradient solution.

turbines.title: Fish-Friendly Turbines
turbines.desc: Advanced designs (e.g. Alden) with fewer blades and wider gaps to reduce blade-strike mortality.

sediment_management.title: Sediment & Erosion Control
sediment_management.subtitle: Protecting Reservoir Capacity & Equipment
sediment_management.intro: Dams trap sediment, reducing capacity and causing turbine abrasion. Proactive management is essential.

flushing.title: Flushing
flushing.desc: Opening low-level outlets to clear accumulation.

watershed.title: Watershed Mgmt
watershed.desc: Reforestation to reduce inflow at source.

vis.title: Visualization
vis.l2: 3D Wear Scans: Quantifying runner material loss.

rcfa.title: RCFA Critical: Diagnosis
rcfa.quote: Treating abrasion without fixing cavitation leads to recurring failure.

water_quality.title: Water Quality & E-Flow
water_quality.subtitle: The Ethical Mandate
water_quality.intro: Maintaining natural flow regimes, temperature, and oxygen levels for downstream habitats.

eflow.title: Environmental Flow (E-flow)
eflow.desc: The managed release of water to mimic natural variability.
eflow.mandate: Mandate: Automatic, continuous measurement and digital documentation is non-negotiable.

aerating.title: Aerating Turbines
aerating.desc: Venting turbines to increase dissolved oxygen levels.

withdrawal.title: Selective Withdrawal
withdrawal.desc: Multi-level intakes to manage water temperature.

habitat_restoration.title: Habitat Restoration
habitat_restoration.subtitle: Beyond Mitigation
habitat_restoration.intro: Proactive measures to create a net positive environmental outcome.

gravel.title: Gravel Augmentation
gravel.desc: Placing clean gravels for fish spawning habitats.

riparian.title: Riparian Zone
riparian.desc: Re-planting native vegetation to stabilize banks and shade water.

structures.title: In-stream Structures
structures.desc: Boulders and logs creating complex flow habitats.

standardOfExcellence.title: Standard of Excellence
standardOfExcellence.subtitle: The defining constitution of AnoHUB operations.
standardOfExcellence.masterclassSubtitle: Masterclass modules for moving from simple protocol compliance to systemic mastery.

p1.title: The 0.05 mm/m Imperative
p1.desc: Absolute alignment precision. Verticality and horizontality deviations exceeding 0.05 mm per meter constitute a critical non-conformity. No deviations accepted regardless of OEM allowances.
p1.quote: "Precision is not an option; it is the baseline."

p2.title: Zero "Run-to-Failure"
p2.desc: Predictive maintenance is mandatory. Operating an asset until component failure is a violation of the Asset Stewardship Protocol. Sensors must be active and monitored.

p3.title: Data Integrity
p3.desc: All operational data, logs, and risk assessments must be immutable and archived. concealing operational risks or "massaging" numbers is grounds for immediate contract termination.

p4.title: Ownership Maintenance
p4.desc: Operators act as owners. Cleaning, tightening, and basic inspections are daily rituals, not scheduled chores. Visual inspections must be logged digitally.
p4.quote: "If you operate it, you own it."

m1.title: Hydrodynamic Immunity
m1.problem: Elimination of cavitation and erosion by design
m1.content: Mandatory use of 13Cr4Ni steel and advanced blade design to create inherent plant immunity to chronic hydrodynamic failures. This is a fundamental step in LCC optimization.

m2.title: Flawless Execution
m2.content: Digital verification system (3D scanning), laser alignment mandates (0.05 mm/m) and documented torque protocols bridging the execution gap.

m3.title: Operational Resilience
m3.content: Use of AI acoustic monitoring and baseline 'fingerprints' to apply Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA), discovering instability at 60% of ISO limits before damage occurs.

m4.title: Cultural Mandate
m4.problem: Closing the human capital execution gap
m4.content: Integration of technical precision with a culture of excellence, where gender equity and diverse teams are recognized as key assets for closing the execution gap.

m5.title: Knowledge Retention
m5.content: Mandate for a digital knowledge base where all root cause analyses and field data are documented, ensuring continuous learning to prevent failure recurrence.

m6.title: Supply Chain Excellence
m6.content: Certified partner program and material traceability mandate (EN 10204 3.1) to eliminate a critical source of systemic risk and ensure long-term performance.

partnerMandate.title: Certified Partner Mandate
partnerMandate.text: The material traceability mandate (EN 10204 3.1) is unquestionable. it represents the ultimate ethical defense against financial risk and premature failures caused by counterfeit materials.

oath.title: Engineer's Oath
oath.desc: By activating this protocol, you bind your digital identity to these standards.

turbineDetail.notFoundDesc: No engineering data available for asset ID:
turbineDetail.subtitle: Technical breakdown of critical subsystems and failure modes.
turbineDetail.criticalityNote: CRITICALITY ASSESSMENT BASED ON RCFA HISTORICAL DATA

francis.title: Francis Turbine • Fault Isolation
francis.subtitle: Enter current telemetry to validate against SOP limits (Ref: SOP-ROT-001).

vibration_excess.0: Immediate load rejection across all units.
vibration_excess.1: Disengage primary guide bearings for inspection.
vibration_excess.2: Perform laser alignment audit of main shaft.

bearing_overheat.0: Forced shutdown of affected turbine unit.
bearing_overheat.1: Verify cooling system flow and pressure.

passport.title: Engineering Dossier
passport.noMaintenance: No maintenance history recorded for this asset.

pelton.highNsq: + High specific speed for Pelton (requires multi-jet)
pelton.highHead: + High head provides optimal kinetic energy
pelton.silt: + Ease of bucket replacement handles silt better

francis.mediumHead: + Head is within standard medium-head range
francis.fixedBlade: - Fixed blade geometry less efficient for flow variations
francis.siltErosion: - Submerged runner susceptible to silt erosion

kaplan.variableFlow: + Double regulation handles variable flow efficiently

crossflow.selfCleaning: + Self-cleaning runner handles debris and silt well

ui.resetDataDesc: Reset demo data to restore the default work orders, component health, and operating hours. This will reload the application.
ui.resetDataConfirm: Reset all demo data? This will clear localStorage and reload the page.

ai.title: Dr. Turbine AI

nominal.title: ALL SYSTEMS NOMINAL
nominal.details: Cavitation risk: LOW • Bearing temp: NORMAL • Vibration: ACCEPTABLE

ai.gridRisk: Frequency deviation >5% indicates potential generator decoupling. Risk of mechanical resonance at {{freq}}Hz.
ai.cavitationRisk: Flow: {{flow}} m³/s, Head: {{head}}m exceeds cavitation threshold. Runner clearance may be insufficient.
ai.acceptable: System parameters within acceptable range. Monitoring continues.

control.scramConfirm: INITIATE EMERGENCY SCRAM? This will trip the turbine and may cause downtime.
control.head: Head (m)

report.title: Diagnostic Forensic Dossier
report.generated_by: Generated by AnoHUB NC-4.2 Neural Core

status.normalDesc: All systems operating within engineering parameters.

health.label: HEALTH
health.calcDescription: Health Score is calculated dynamically based on module status.

step1.title: Verify HPU Health
step1.desc: Is Oil Pressure > 120 Bar? Is Nitrogen Level OK?

step2.title: Distributor Status
step2.desc: Are Guide Vanes at ABSOLUTE 0%? (Verify 'Squeeze' Pressure)

step3.title: Open Bypass Valve
step3.desc: Command Bypass OPEN. Wait for Spiral Case to fill.

step5.title: Command MIV OPEN
step5.desc: Monitor Limit Switches. Verify physical arm movement.

step6.title: Initiate Speed-No-Load (SNL)
step6.desc: Release Brakes. PID ramps vanes to Start position.

trigger.title: TRIGGER (T=0s): GRID LOSS
trigger.desc: Breaker Open Signal (52G) confirmed. Severe frequency oscillation detected. Automatic response initiated.

step1.title: 01. GOVERNOR REACTION
step1.desc: Immediate move to Speed-No-Load (SNL) position. Prevent runner overspeed (>130% nominal).

step2.title: 02. MIV 2-STAGE CLOSING
step2.desc: Executing Closing Law to mitigate transient pressure and prevent Penstock burst.

step3.title: 03. BRAKING LOGIC
step3.desc: Waiting for Speed < 20% Nominal. Automatic energization of mechanical brake solenoids.

interlock.title: PRIORITY INTERLOCK: MIV STUCK
interlock.desc: IF MIV Angle remains > 5° after 180s (Logic timer expired):
interlock.note: Squeeze mode directs additional HPU pressure to guide vanes to force closure against foreign objects.

emergencyProtocols.title: EMERGENCY PROTOCOLS
emergencyProtocols.subtitle: FRANCIS HORIZONTAL TURBINE - CRITICAL RESPONSE PROCEDURES
emergencyProtocols.noticeBody: This document contains time-critical procedures. Familiarize yourself with all protocols before an emergency occurs. Response time is measured in SECONDS, not minutes.

p1.title: Load Rejection & Overspeed
p1.scenarioDesc: Grid trip causes instant loss of electrical load. Runner accelerates rapidly (overspeed) due to residual water flow.
p1.dangerDesc: Overspeed > 120% (~720 RPM) risks runner disintegration due to centrifugal forces.
p1.auto2: Governor Commands 'Full Close' to guide vanes (3-5s).
p1.auto3: Overspeed Trip activates mechanical brake at 110%.
p1.man1: 1. Press 'EMERGENCY CLOSE' on control panel immediately.
p1.man2: 2. Manually trigger MIV closure if guide vanes fail.
p1.man3: 3. EVACUATE if speed exceeds 120% and is rising.

p2.title: Silt Flash Flood
p2.desc: Sudden river silt concentration > 3000 ppm. Acts as 'liquid sandpaper,' destroying runner blades and seals.
p2.actCrit: Reduce load to min. Plan shutdown < 2h.

p3.title: HPU Power Loss - Manual Closure
p3.a2: Allow weights to drop MIV to closed position (30-60s).

p4.title: Linkage Failure / Backlash
p4.s1Desc: Erratic guide vane movement (>2% oscillation) at steady load.
p4.s2Desc: Manually close MIV. Disable governor HPU. Physically lock the regulating ring.

p5.title: Generator Fire Suppression
p5.s3: 3. Maintenance Blast: 20% volume for re-ignition prevention.
p5.warnBody: Ventilate generator hall for 30 mins before entry. CO2 concentration is lethal.

p6.title: Grid Frequency Anomaly
p6.desc: Severe desync risk. Mechanical damage likely if unit remains connected.

emergencyProtocols.footer: AnoHUB Turbine Friend • Emergency Response Manual Ref: FR-EP-001

critical.title: CRITICAL INTERLOCK
critical.desc: This module is directly tied to the Mission Control Startup Sequence. Any failure here prevents unit start.

calibration.title: 1. MIV ANGULAR CALIBRATION
calibration.zeroDesc: The limit switch must engage when seat contact is even.
calibration.openDesc: Disc must align perfectly with flow to minimize vortex shedding.

synchronicity.title: 2. DISTRIBUTOR SYNCHRONICITY
synchronicity.desc: The 20 Guide Vanes must move in unison. A single lagging vane creates a 'jet' effect that can destroy runner blades.
synchronicity.step2Desc: At 0% (Squeeze), verify 0.05mm gauge cannot pass between ANY vane seal.
synchronicity.step3Desc: Measure Regulating Ring pin to Vane lever arm. All 20 must match ±1.0mm.
synchronicity.risk: CAVITATION RISK: If Vane #5 is open 2° more than others, it directs a high-velocity jet at the runner, causing pitting within 500 hours.

bearingsCheck.title: MAIN BEARINGS & COOLING
bearingsCheck.s1Desc: The heavy rotating mass floats on a microscopic film of oil. If temperature exceeds 60°C, viscosity drops—thin oil cannot carry the shaft.
bearingsCheck.s1Li1: Metal-to-metal contact leads to catastrophic babbit melting.
bearingsCheck.s1Li2: Prolonged outage and extremely expensive repair costs.
bearingsCheck.s2Li1: Inspect mesh filters daily for river silt.
bearingsCheck.s2Li2: High differential pressure (dP) means flow blockage.
bearingsCheck.s3Li1: Reverse flow direction for 5 minutes every week.
bearingsCheck.s3Li2: Eject deposited sediment acting as insulator.
bearingsCheck.s4Li1: Oil in sight glass looks cloudy or milky.
bearingsCheck.s4Li3: EMERGENCY STOP. Centrifuge or replace oil.
bearingsCheck.tblCheck: Check cooling water flow & clean filters.
bearingsCheck.tblNoRestart: Inspect for babbit damage before restart.
bearingsCheck.dailyDesc: Scrub mesh filters on intake lines.
bearingsCheck.alarmDesc: Immediate sight glass audit for water ingress.

runOut.title: RUN-OUT (TIR) LIMITS
runOut.method: Method: Dial indicator on shaft surface during slow manual rotation.

laser.title: LASER ALIGNMENT PRECISION
laser.thermalDesc: Set Generator 0.15mm LOWER than Turbine when cold. Generator grows upwards during operation due to thermal expansion.

softFoot.title: SOFT FOOT AUDIT
softFoot.desc: Ensure all 4 generator feet sit perfectly flat on sole plates before final bolt torque.

coolingWater.title: COOLING WATER SYSTEM
coolingWater.dpDesc: dP monitoring determines automatic cleaning cycles.
coolingWater.trig: Trigger: dP > 0.5 Bar OR Timer (12 h)

drainagePumps.title: DRAINAGE & DEWATERING
drainagePumps.dutyDesc: Lead/Lag assignment swaps every 24 hours to equalize runtime wear.
drainagePumps.m1D: Verify no backflow when pump stops. Hammering indicates valve failure.
drainagePumps.m2D: Clear sludge/debris monthly. Cavitation noise indicates blockage.
drainagePumps.m3D: Max continuous: 80°C. Check cooling fan intake.
drainagePumps.s3Desc: Station sump may contain oil-mixed water. Ensure Oil-Water Separator (OWS) is active before pumping to tailrace.

lubrication.title: LUBRICATION CONTROL PROTOCOL
lubrication.blockDesc: If System Pressure > 250 Bar, Pump trips automatically. Inspect divider blocks for mechanical seizure immediately.

governorPID.title: ⚙ Governor PID Tuning
governorPID.subtitle: Proportional-Integral-Derivative Control System
governorPID.syncDesc: Never adjust PID parameters while unit is synchronized to grid without dispatcher approval.
governorPID.loadDesc: Perform tuning tests under stable load conditions (avoid sudden load changes during testing).
governorPID.estopDesc: Ensure Emergency Stop button is accessible and functional before starting tests.
governorPID.commDesc: Notify operations center before initiating response tests.
governorPID.govDesc: The Governor controls the position of 20 wicket gates to maintain constant turbine speed (typically 500 RPM for 12-pole generator at 50 Hz).
governorPID.errEq: Speed Error = Target Speed - Actual Speed
governorPID.propDesc: Reacts proportionally to the current speed error.
governorPID.highPDesc: Fast response, but may cause overshoot and oscillations.
governorPID.propAnalogy: Like a driver turning the wheel harder the further off course they are.
governorPID.intDesc: Eliminates steady-state error by accumulating error over time.
governorPID.highIDesc: Fast elimination of offset, but can cause "wind-up" and instability.
governorPID.intAnalogy: Like a driver remembering how long they've been off course and correcting accordingly.
governorPID.diffDesc: Predicts future error based on rate of change and applies damping.
governorPID.highDDesc: Strong damping, but sensitive to noise (can cause jittering).
governorPID.diffAnalogy: Like a driver anticipating a curve and starting to turn before reaching it.
governorPID.dbDesc: is a small speed range (e.g. ±0.1 RPM) where the governor ignores speed deviations and does not move the wicket gates.
governorPID.wearDesc: Constant micro-adjustments cause excessive wear on servomotors, linkage pins, and gate bearings.
governorPID.huntDesc: Without dead-band, governor would constantly "hunt" for exact setpoint, causing oscillations.
governorPID.noiseDesc: Filters out small speed fluctuations caused by grid noise or sensor jitter.
governorPID.techNoteDesc: Dead-band found during linkage inspection (mechanical "play" in pins) is physical dead-band caused by wear. This is different from electronic dead-band in governor software. Both must be minimized.
governorPID.stepDesc: Controlled test where load is changed abruptly by a fixed amount (typically 10% rated power) to observe how governor responds.
governorPID.initDesc: Unit synchronized to grid, stable load (e.g. 5.0 MW).
governorPID.baseDesc: Monitor speed, gate position, and power output for 2 minutes.
governorPID.stepApplyDesc: Increase load setpoint by 10% (e.g. 5.0 MW → 5.5 MW).
governorPID.respDesc: Record speed and gate position for 5 minutes.
governorPID.analyzeDesc: Measure overshoot, settling time, and oscillation frequency.
governorPID.overshootDesc: Speed must not exceed setpoint by more than 5%
governorPID.settleDesc: Time to stabilize within ±1% of setpoint
governorPID.oscDesc: Should damp out quickly without sustained hunting
governorPID.visualAid: [Visualization: Step Response Graph - Time vs. Speed/Power] Ideal: Fast rise → Small overshoot → Quick settling | Bad: Slow rise OR Large overshoot OR Sustained oscillations
governorPID.huntDefDesc: is continuous oscillation of wicket gates around setpoint, causing speed and power to fluctuate.
governorPID.symp1: Speed oscillates ±0.2 - 0.5 RPM at regular frequency (e.g. every 3-5 seconds).
governorPID.symp3: Audible "clicking" or "thumping" from servomotors or linkage.
governorPID.symp4: Increased wear on linkage pins and bushings.
governorPID.cause1Desc: This is a problem identified during pin inspection:
governorPID.wornDesc: Gap > 0.5 mm between pin and bushing.
governorPID.mechEffDesc: Servomotor moves, but gates don't respond immediately, causing late feedback loop.
governorPID.mechSol: Replace worn pins and bushings, retorque all linkage bolts.
governorPID.causeIDesc: I value too high, causing "integral wind-up".
governorPID.solI: Reduce I gain by 20-30% and retest.
governorPID.causeDDesc: D value too low, insufficient oscillation damping.
governorPID.solD: Increase D gain by 10-20% and retest.
governorPID.effDbDesc: Governor responds to noise, causing constant micro-adjustments.
governorPID.mechInspDesc: Check all linkage pins for play (target < 0.2 mm gap).
governorPID.freqDesc: Fast oscillations (< 2 sec) = mechanical issue. Slow oscillations (> 5 sec) = PID issue.
governorPID.isolateDesc: Temporarily increase dead-band to 0.3 RPM. If hunting stops, problem is PID tuning. If continues, problem is mechanical.
governorPID.pLogic: If response too slow, increase P by 0.5. If overshoot excessive, decrease P by 0.5.
governorPID.iLogic: If steady-state error persists, increase I by 0.2. If hunting occurs, decrease I by 0.2.
governorPID.dLogic: If oscillations poorly damped, increase D by 0.1. If response jittery, decrease D by 0.05.
governorPID.repeat: Repeat steps 2-5 until optimal response achieved.
governorPID.recordFinal: Record final PID values and response graphs in unit log.
governorPID.goal: Tuning Goal: Fast Response + Minimal Overshoot + No Hunting
governorPID.monDesc: SCADA system with speed, power, and gate position trends.
governorPID.toolsDesc: Calipers (for measuring linkage play), torque wrench.

generatorIntegrity.title: GENERATOR INTEGRITY
generatorIntegrity.s1Desc: Carbon brushes wear down, creating conductive dust. In high humidity, this dust creates 'tracking paths' for electricity to jump to the stator frame (Flash-over / Ground Fault).
generatorIntegrity.s1Rule: CLEANLINESS IS NOT AESTHETICS; IT IS INSULATION INTEGRITY.
generatorIntegrity.b1Desc: Never wait for the wire shunt to touch the slip ring. Monitor groove wear monthly.
generatorIntegrity.b2Desc: Too soft = Sparking/Burn Marks. Too hard = Rapid premature groove wear.
generatorIntegrity.heatDesc: Whenever the unit is SHUT DOWN, anti-condensation heaters MUST be ACTIVE. This prevents windings from absorbing tropical moisture.
generatorIntegrity.t1Desc: 500V/1000V DC on Stator/Rotor. Correct all readings to 40°C baseline for trend analysis.
generatorIntegrity.t2Desc: Inspect for discolored lugs or melted tape (High Resistance). Torque verification required.

braking.title: BRAKING SYSTEM PROTOCOL
braking.lockDesc: IF Speed > 30% THEN BLOCK AIR. Braking at high RPM creates extreme heat resulting in Rotor cracking or Fire Risk.
braking.warnDesc: Brake dust is carcinogenic. Do not enter generator barrel during or immediately after braking. Wear P3 masks.
braking.jackDesc: PURPOSE: Lifts the 350-ton rotor by 10mm to flood thrust pads with oil before start (required if idle > 72 hours).

gridSync.title: GRID SYNCHRONIZATION
gridSync.s1Desc: To close the GCB (Generator Circuit Breaker), three parameters must be matched perfectly between the unit and the grid.
gridSync.s2Desc: If the automatic sync relay (25G) fails, use the three-lamp method. Connect lamps between generator and bus phases.
gridSync.ruleDesc: Lamps go dark when phase difference is zero. Close breaker at peak of darkness.
gridSync.failDesc: Closing the breaker out-of-sync creates a massive torque pulse (slugging). This can sheer shaft coupling bolts or twist the generator windings. NEVER force a manual sync if parameters are moving fast.

distributorSync.title: DISTRIBUTOR SYNCHRONIZATION
distributorSync.subtitle: Mechanical Geometry & Guide Vane Alignment Protocol
distributorSync.s1Desc: If just ONE guide vane is misaligned (e.g. Vane #4 is at 25° while others are at 20°), it acts as a 'flow disturber', creating a massive turbulent vortex.
distributorSync.s1Warn: This vortex hits the runner blades cyclically, leading to localized cavitation and shaft fatigue.
distributorSync.s3Desc: Execute at 0% closure. Darkness required in runner chamber; high-power LEDs in spiral case.
distributorSync.s3Check: If light is visible as a beam, the gap is > 0.2mm. ADJUSTMENT REQUIRED.
distributorSync.s4Desc: If a shear pin breaks, the vane becomes 'free-floating'. It will flutter violently.
distributorSync.s4Rule: ACTION: Immediate emergency shutdown. A floating vane will destroy the runner.

hpu.title: Critical SOP: HPU & Nitrogen Systems
hpu.subtitle: Ref: 1.3 MW Francis Units | Pressure Hygiene & ESD Protocol
hpu.dangerDesc: Hydraulic oil at 100+ bar is lethal.
hpu.deEnDesc: Before any HPU disassembly, open manual ball valves to drain Accumulators back to tank. Manometer must show 0 bar.
hpu.injectDesc: Never use hands to check for leaks. Pressurized leak can inject oil into bloodstream.
hpu.accDesc: Accumulators are the 'Battery' of the safety system. They allow MIV closing even if power (pumps) fails.
hpu.p0Rule: P0 should be approx. 90% of Minimum Operating Pressure (Pmin).
hpu.techNoteDesc: If nitrogen requires frequent recharging, the rubber bladder is likely porous and needs replacement.
hpu.sludgeDesc: Sludge is the enemy of hydraulic precision. 'Stiction' in valves causes jerky MIV movement.
hpu.hammerDesc: Dirty oil leads to valve sticking. If valve sticks then releases suddenly, MIV can slam shut.

dcSystems.title: DC CONTROL SYSTEMS
dcSystems.critDc: Critical Interlock: DC Voltage < 95V triggers immediate Emergency Shutdown (ESD). Protection relays cannot trip guide vanes without DC control power.
dcSystems.efDesc: Continuous insulation monitoring between DC(+) and Ground. Detects cable moisture or insulation breakdown.

elecHealth.title: ELECTRICAL HEALTH & INSULATION
elecHealth.s1Desc: Generator windings (6.6-11kV) degrade invisibly. Insulation breakdown causes 'Slot Discharge' and total winding failure. A stator rewind costs >$100,000 and months of catastrophic downtime.
elecHealth.c1Desc: Detect sharp, chlorine-like smell at air exits when unit is at >70% load. Indicates active high-voltage discharge.
elecHealth.c2Desc: Visual grey/white residue in winding slots is a byproduct of resin breakdown by ozone (Bushing Corona).
elecHealth.tDesc: Typically, 1.3MW units use Class F insulation. Normal operating rise should remain ~110°C.
elecHealth.ruleDesc: Anti-condensation heaters MUST activate within 5s of Main Breaker opening. 48h shutdown in tropical humidity without heaters = insulation drop from 100MΩ to <1MΩ (DANGER).

auxiliary.title: Critical SOP: Braking & Sump Systems
auxiliary.subtitle: Auxiliary Support & Flood Prevention
auxiliary.s1Desc: Sleeve bearings rely on a hydrodynamic oil wedge. This wedge collapses at low RPM.
auxiliary.s1Li1: If the unit spins slowly for too long (> 5 mins) without stopping, the shaft wipes the bearing metal.
auxiliary.s1Li2: Brakes MUST separate the pad from the disc automatically at > 15% RPM to prevent fire, but MUST engage firm at < 20-30% RPM to arrest rotation quickly.
auxiliary.sop1Desc: Controlled arrest of the 5-ton rotating mass.
auxiliary.s2Li1: Brakes should deploy automatically when speed drops to 20-30% of rated RPM.
auxiliary.s2Li3: Bearing damage due to low-speed rotation without oil film.
auxiliary.s3Li1: Brake dust is conductive (mixed with metal). Vacuum it out after every 50 stops.
auxiliary.s3Li2: Replace pads when wear indicator is reached (typically < 5mm remaining material).
auxiliary.sop2Desc: The sump is the last line of defense against flooding.
auxiliary.s4Li4: If the sump fills faster than 2 pumps can clear, there is a major hydraulic rupture (MIV seal or Burst pipe). The unit must stop to reduce system pressure.
auxiliary.weeklyDesc: Test Sump Pump float switches (lift manually).
auxiliary.monthlyDesc: Clean Brake Dust from caliper area.

penstock.title: PENSTOCK INTEGRITY PROTOCOL
penstock.maintDesc: Inject sealing grease (Graphite) if weeping occurs. Do not overtighten packing bolts (risk of seizure).
penstock.s3Desc: Critical structural check after Hydraulic Hammer events (Code: M-04-ANC).
penstock.chk2D: Check alignment markers on sliding supports.
penstock.chk3D: Ensure block weep holes are clear to prevent uplift.

intake.title: INTAKE & SEDIMENT MANAGEMENT
intake.s1P1: Logic: Every leaf, branch, or plastic bag on the rack creates flow resistance.
intake.s1Li1: Head Loss (dH): Head Loss = Lost Power. A 1-meter drop due to a blocked rack is pure financial loss.
intake.s1Li2: Cleanliness Rule: A clean intake is the first line of defense. If trash passes the rack, it destroys MIV seals and blocks guide vanes.
intake.s2P1: The intake rack is the lungs of the hydro system. It must breathe freely.
intake.s3Oli1: Check silt level weekly (daily during high water).
intake.s3Oli2: Open bottom outlets to flush accumulated sediment back to river.
intake.s3Oli3: Ensure flushing tunnel is clear and flow returns only when water is clear.
intake.cl3: Emergency Rack Inspect due to heavy debris.

excitation.title: EXCITATION & AVR CONTROL
excitation.s1Desc: Residual magnetism in large rotors is often insufficient to start the bridge. External 110V DC flashing is required at 95% rated speed.
excitation.critDesc: If Field Flashing > 10s: Thermal damage to start resistors will occur. Emergency stop immediately if field does not build up after 5s injection.
excitation.limDesc: Prevents core over-saturation. If frequency drops to 45Hz, AVR must automatically drop excitation to protect the main transformer core from overheating.

transformer.title: TRANSFORMER INTEGRITY
transformer.dgaDesc: Dissolved Gas Analysis (DGA) is the 'blood test' for transformers. Presence of Acetylene (C2H2) indicates internal arcing and requires immediate unit isolation.
transformer.buDesc: If alarm triggers, collect gas sample using syringe. White gas = Insulation burn. Yellow gas = Wood/Paper burn.

coupling.title: COUPLING & ALIGNMENT
coupling.subtitle: Zero-Stress Coupling Logic & Foundation Settlement
coupling.s1Desc: Since 2014, the powerhouse foundation has likely shifted. For a 1.3 MW unit spinning at 750/1000 RPM, the margin for error is microscopic.
coupling.s1Warn: A vertical shift of only 0.10mm creates a permanent bending force (Cyclic Loading) that will eventually shear the shaft or melt a bearing.
coupling.s2Desc: Parallel mismatch: Generator centerline is higher/lower than turbine centerline.
coupling.s3Desc: Gap/Zazor mismatch: Coupling faces are not parallel (open at top or side).
coupling.s4L1: Mount dial indicators to read Rim (Radial) and Face (Axial).
coupling.s4L2: Rotate both shafts together in 90° increments (12:00, 3:00, 6:00, 9:00).
coupling.s4L3: Record Total Indicator Reading (TIR). Pass threshold: ≤ 0.05 mm.
coupling.loctiteDesc: Vibration is constant. Mechanical washers are insufficient. Apply Loctite 243 (Blue) to threads during final torquing.
coupling.symptDesc: A low-frequency 'Growl' or 'Hum' coming from the coupling guard indicates misalignment.

cathodic.title: CATHODIC PROTECTION SYSTEM
cathodic.s1Desc: Sacrificial Anodes (Zinc/Aluminum) create a galvanic cell where the anode corrodes instead of the turbine runner. Without this, the runner becomes the anode and dissolves into the water.
cathodic.ruleDesc: If an anode has lost >50% of its original mass or shows deep pitting, replace it immediately. Residual mass cannot sustain the protective current.
cathodic.specNote: Measure from the anode surface to the turbine casing using a calibrated multimeter.
cathodic.l1: Grind base plate to bare metal. NO PAINT under the anode.
cathodic.l2: Use Grade 316 Stainless Steel bolts only. No carbon steel.
cathodic.l3: Tighten until spring washers are fully flat for max contact.
cathodic.warnDesc: If the interface is painted or greasy, the anode is 'Blind'—it looks okay but provides ZERO protection.
cathodic.critAlert: CRITICAL: High resistance (>5Ω) = Passive Corrosion Active.
cathodic.obs1: Anode looks brand new after 1 year

regRing.title: REGULATING RING & ECCENTRIC PINS
regRing.subtitle: The 'Forgotten' Friction - Stiction Analysis & Vane Synchronization
regRing.context: The regulating ring is the mechanical translator between the hydraulic servomotor and all 20 guide vanes. It converts linear force into rotational motion.
regRing.risk: Risk: If sliding surfaces are not perfectly lubricated, the governor will 'hunt' (oscillate).
regRing.rootCause: Root Cause: Stiction (static friction) creates resistance that the HPU overcomes with pressure spikes.
regRing.impact: Impact: Oscillations cause simultaneous wear on all 20 vanes and unstable power delivery.
regRing.s1Intro: Stiction is invisible but measurable through HPU pressure behavior during slow movement.
regRing.s1RiskText: After extended shutdown, sliding surfaces are dry. The first HPU stroke encounters maximum stiction.
regRing.s1Action: MANDATORY: Manual grease application BEFORE energizing HPU.
regRing.s1Step1: Monitor HPU pressure gauge in real-time.
regRing.s1Step2: Command governor 0% to 10% open at slowest manual speed.
regRing.s1Pass: PASS: Pressure rises gradually to ~140-150 bar and holds steady.
regRing.s1Fail: FAIL: Pressure spikes to 160-180 bar, then drops (Sawtooth pattern).
regRing.s2Intro: Eccentric pins fine-tune vane angular position. All 20 vanes must touch stops SIMULTANEOUSLY.
regRing.s2Physics: Physics: Asymmetric closing (e.g. Vane #1 at 0°, #12 at 0.5°) causes turbulence and efficiency loss.
regRing.s2Step1: Safety Lockout: Unit stopped, MIV closed, pressure released.
regRing.s2Step3: Inspect gap at stop surface. Target: ≤ 0.2mm variation.
regRing.s2Step4: Rotate eccentric bushing (2-3° rotation ≈ 0.5mm travel) to synchronize.
regRing.s3Step1: Remove inspection cover. Wipe sliding surfaces clean.
regRing.s3Step2: Apply high-temp water-resistant grease to rollers, tracks, and bushings.
regRing.s3Step3: Manually rotate ring 0-100% to distribute grease.
regRing.diagAct1: Immediate Action: Stop and lubricate ring.

linkage.title: GOVERNOR LINKAGE & DISTRIBUTOR
linkage.subtitle: Mechanical Synchronization & Transmission
linkage.context: Context: Hydraulic piston pushes Regulating Ring, rotating 20 wicket gates.
linkage.risk: Risk: 1mm pin wear = ~5% loss in synchronization. Causes fluttering and efficiency loss.
linkage.s1Logic: The system is a chain. A chain is only as strong as its weakest link (pin).
linkage.s1Step1: Static Check: Grab link arm by hand (Unit stopped/crossed out).
linkage.s1Step2: Push/Pull: Shake the arm to detect play.
linkage.s1Fail: FAIL: 'Clicking' sound or visible movement. Replace bushing immediately.
linkage.s2Desc: Friction causes hunting. Grease is the stabilizer.
linkage.s2Audit: Audit: Check central pump builds 150-200 bar.
linkage.s2Vis: Visual: Inspect all 20 gate shafts. Look for FRESH RING OF GREASE purging from seals.
linkage.s3Safety: Safety: Mechanical Safety Pin REMOVED (Control Risk!).
linkage.s3Proc: Disconnect servomotor. Two technicians must be able to push ring 0-100% by hand.
linkage.s3Crit: Criteria: Smooth movement. No binding, hard spots, or jumping.
linkage.chk1: Monthly: Check 'Grease Rings' on all 20 gates.

recovery.title: SHAFT SEAL RECOVERY PROTOCOL
recovery.csDesc: The Shaft Seal Recovery Protocol is being calibrated for 1.3MW operations. Restoring engineering constants... please wait for the next deployment.

oilHealth.label: Oil Health
oilHealth.title: 🧪 OIL HEALTH & AERATION DIAGNOSTICS
oilHealth.subtitle: Hydraulic System Fluid Chemistry
oilHealth.hdr_desc: Understanding foam, aeration, and contamination in HPU systems
oilHealth.safety_1: Pressure Release: Depressurize HPU system before opening any oil circuit (nitrogen accumulator risk).
oilHealth.safety_2: Hot Oil: Operating temperature can reach 55-65°C. Wear protective gloves when handling components.
oilHealth.safety_3: Fire Risk: Hydraulic oil is flammable. Keep ignition sources away during inspection or sampling.
oilHealth.diff_states: Two distinct states affecting hydraulic oil, each with different causes and consequences:
oilHealth.large_bubbles:
Large bubbles on oil surface
Visible in sight glass
oilHealth.low_lvl:
Low oil level
Suction line leak
Vortex formation
oilHealth.bulk_desc: The "stiffness" of hydraulic oil under pressure. Clean oil has high modulus (fast, precise response). Aerated oil has low modulus (slow, "spongy" feel).
oilHealth.norm_oil: Normal Oil: Governor Command → Instant wicket gate movement (< 0.5 sec)
oilHealth.aer_oil: Aerated Oil: Governor Command → Delayed, uncertain movement (1-2 sec lag) → Frequency hunting
oilHealth.crit_eff_desc: Aeration is a major cause of "soft" governor response and frequency instability on your 1.3 MW units.
oilHealth.foam_symp: Symptom: Large bubbles (> 1 mm) on oil surface, forming and bursting rapidly.
oilHealth.water_desc: Even 0.1% water can cause severe foaming.
oilHealth.water_test: Test: Karl Fischer moisture test. Target: < 200 ppm water.
oilHealth.det_act: Action: Drain, flush with clean oil, refill fresh.
oilHealth.vel_chk: Check: Pump inlet velocity should be < 1.2 m/s.
oilHealth.proc_1: Observe sight glass while unit running. Note bubble size and persistence.
oilHealth.proc_2: If large, persistent foam present → Sample oil for water content.
oilHealth.proc_3: If water > 500 ppm → Drain and refill tank.
oilHealth.proc_4: If water < 500 ppm but foaming persists → Check pump suction design for vortices.
oilHealth.aer_symp: Symptom: Milky, cloudy appearance throughout volume. Oil looks "whipped" or "emulsified".
oilHealth.low_oil_desc: Pump suction pulls surface vortex, ingesting air.
oilHealth.low_oil_check: Check: Maintain oil level at 75-85% of sight glass height.
oilHealth.suct_leak_desc: Air ingress through loose fittings or cracked hose.
oilHealth.suct_leak_test: Test: Pressurize suction line with air, spray soapy water to find leaks.
oilHealth.seal_dmg_desc: Pump shaft seal admits air on suction stroke.
oilHealth.seal_symp: Symptom: Oil foams rhythmically with pump stroke.
oilHealth.vortex_sol: Solution: Install anti-vortex plate at suction inlet.
oilHealth.aer_proc_1: Check oil level immediately. If low, top up and observe if cloudiness clears in 10-15 min.
oilHealth.aer_proc_2: If level OK, inspect all suction line connections for tightness.
oilHealth.aer_proc_3: Perform "Leak Test": Isolate suction line, pressurize to 0.5 bar, soap spray joints.
oilHealth.aer_proc_4: If no external leaks found → Suspect pump shaft seal. Listen for rhythmic "whining" sound.
oilHealth.vis_diag_title: Visual Diagnostics - HPU Sight Glass Interpretation
oilHealth.what_to_look: What to Look For at Sight Glass
oilHealth.norm_2: Transparency: Can see through glass to opposite side
oilHealth.norm_3: Bubbles: Few or none; present ones should rise and vanish quickly
oilHealth.norm_4: Sediment: No visible sediment at glass bottom
oilHealth.int_leak: Identifying Internal Leaks in Governor Valves
oilHealth.leak_purpose: Purpose: Determine if oil is leaking internally between pilot valve and main distributing valve, causing slow response.
oilHealth.isol_desc: Close main isolation valve to governor. Release pressure.
oilHealth.pre_chk_desc: Inspect all external joints for oil weeping. Wipe clean and mark with chalk.
oilHealth.dry_1: Remove oil from valve housing with compressed air (low pressure, 2-3 bar).
oilHealth.dry_3: Re-inspect marked areas for fresh oil presence.
oilHealth.pilot_leak: Pilot Valve Leak: Oil appears around pilot piston housing → Replace seals.
oilHealth.main_leak: Main Valve Leak: Oil appears on main valve body → Repair main valve.
oilHealth.daily_chk: Daily: Visual check of HPU sight glass for cloudiness or bubbles.
oilHealth.weekly_chk: Weekly: Check oil level, top up if below 75% of glass.
oilHealth.mth_chk: Monthly: Acoustic scan of HPU pump for cavitation sounds.
oilHealth.quart_chk: Quarterly: Oil analysis (viscosity, water content, particle count).
oilHealth.yr_chk: Annually: Complete oil change if any of following:
oilHealth.samp_1: Run unit for 30 minutes to reach operating temp (50-60°C).
oilHealth.samp_2: Take sample from middle depth of tank (not surface, not bottom) with clean syringe.
oilHealth.samp_3: Fill bottle, label with date, unit ID, running hours.

waterHammer.title: [EN] Analiza Hidrauličkog Udara
waterHammer.subtitle: [EN] Proračun Prijelaznog Pritiska prema IEC 60041 Standardu
waterHammer.sec1Desc: [EN] Elastičnost cjevovoda i stišljivost vode određuju brzinu propagacije talasa (a).
waterHammer.sec2Note: [EN] Proračun koristi Žukovskijevu jednačinu za naglo rasterećenje.
waterHammer.sec3Desc: [EN] Sinhronizovano zatvaranje između sprovodnog aparata i MIV-a.
waterHammer.sec4Desc: [EN] Pritisak udara upoređen sa naponom u zidu cijevi za čelik razreda S235JR.

waterHammer.title: Water Hammer Surge Analysis
waterHammer.subtitle: IEC 60041 Standard Pressure Transient Calculation
waterHammer.sec1Desc: Elasticity of penstock and water compressibility determine wave propagation speed (a).
waterHammer.sec2Note: Calculation uses Joukowsky's equation for sudden rejection.
waterHammer.sec3Desc: Synchronized closure between Guide Vane and MIV.
waterHammer.sec4Desc: Surge pressure compared against hoop stress of steel grade S235JR.

vortex.title: VORTEX CONTROL & DRAFT TUBE DYNAMICS
vortex.s1Desc: At 40-60% load, water exits the runner with residual swirl, creating a helical vortex rope. If the vortex frequency matches structural resonance, damage accumulates rapidly.
vortex.step1Desc: Adjust power from 20% to 100% in 5% increments.
vortex.step2Desc: Hold each load for 3 minutes to allow vortex stabilization.
vortex.ruleText: Limit continuous run in Red Zone (>4.0mm/s) to < 2 hours. Request dispatch load shift immediately.
vortex.airDesc: Air admission disrupts vortex coherence. It's a precision tool, not just venting.
vortex.tune1: Open valve in 10% steps at known rough loads.
vortex.tune3: Verify seasonal head changes (Monsoon vs Dry).
vortex.compWarn: If pressure drops < 1.5 Bar during injection, compressor is undersized.

thrustBalance.title: THRUST BEARING & HYDRAULIC BALANCE
thrustBalance.subtitle: Axial Force Neutralization Logic
thrustBalance.s1Desc: While main bearings handle radial weight, the thrust bearing faces massive horizontal forces. If the runner balance holes clog, the load can triple instantly.
thrustBalance.intentDesc: 4-8 holes in the runner hub allow high-pressure water to bypass to the draft tube side, reducing axial load from 220kN to its safe 80-100kN design range.
thrustBalance.siltDesc: River Unit 1 carries high silt during monsoon. Blockage is a guaranteed mechanical degradation factor.
